segments.text: Can I help you ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I need to buy a computer for this semester . I was told it is cheaper to buy computers here .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , you heard right . You can get an excellent deal on a new computer here . We have great discounts for students .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't know much about computers . But I know I want a desktop computer with a lot of memory . And I need a printer .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , first let's consider your computer . Here , for example , is a system I highly recommend-the Power Macintosh G3 . it comes with 64 megabytes of total memory .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Is that a lot ? Sixty-four ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it is . It should be enough for any student needs you might have . What department are you in ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: History .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , so you will mostly be using word processing , for writing papers . I recommend the Corel Word Perfect program for word processing . We can talk about software later . Let's talk about your hardware first . We have a special deal on right now . I should tell you about it , as it only goes until next Tuesday . If you buy one of these fifteen-inch color monitors with a Power Macintosh G3 , you can actually get 30 percent off the usual sale price .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Thirty percent ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Wow . That's really good . And you think this is really a good system for a graduate student ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes . It's an excellent system .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hmm . Hey , wait . This has an Apple on it . Is this an Apple computer ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes , it's a Macintosh . It's Apple . Mcintosh and Apple are the same thing .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: I don't want Macintosh . I want PC .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: I'm sorry , but our university computer center only sells Macintosh equipment .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: What ? Are you serious ?
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Yes .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But nobody uses Macintosh !
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: That's not true . Most of the students and professors in the university here use Macintosh . They find it is better for writing and word-processing , and that is what students mostly do . May I ask where you're from ?
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Yes , I'm from Taiwan .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: Well , I know that in most Asian countries Apple is not very popular . But here in America , especially in universities and publishing companies , Apple is very commonly used .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: But I need a computer that can handle writing in Chinese .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: There are several Chinese writing programs you can use with Macintosh . Chinese is no problem for Apple .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Hmm . I think I should ask some of my friends for advice before I make a decision . I'm sorry .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: No , don't be sorry . It's reasonable to ask your friends . But believe me , most of the students here in the university-Asian students included-most of them use Apple .
segments.speaker: S1

segments.text: Well , thanks for your advice . I will probably come back later .
segments.speaker: S2

segments.text: You're very welcome . Here is my card , if you need any help .
segments.speaker: S1
